channel.title: math.GT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Edge subdivisions and the $L^2$-homology of right-angled Coxeter groups
item.description: arXiv:2411.08009v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: If $L$ is a flag triangulation of $S^{n-1}$, then the Davis complex $\Sigma_L$ for the associated right-angled Coxeter group $W_L$ is a contractible $n$-manifold. A special case of a conjecture of Singer predicts that the $L^2$-homology of such $\Sigma_L$ vanishes outside the middle dimension. We give conditions which guarantee this vanishing is preserved under edge subdivision of $L$. In particular, we verify Singer's conjecture when $L$ is the barycentric subdivision of the boundary of an $n$-simplex, and for general barycentric subdivisions of triangulations of $S^{2n-1}$. Using this, we construct explicit counterexamples to a torsion growth analogue of Singer's conjecture.
item.dc:creator: Grigori Avramidi, Boris Okun, Kevin Schreve

item.title: Density of systoles of hyperbolic manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2404.15927v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that for each $n \geq 2$, the systoles of closed hyperbolic $n$-manifolds form a dense subset of $(0, +\infty)$. We also show that for any $n\geq 2$ and any Salem number $\lambda$, there is a closed arithmetic hyperbolic $n$-manifold of systole $\log(\lambda)$. In particular, the Salem conjecture holds if and only if the systoles of closed arithmetic hyperbolic manifolds in some (any) dimension fail to be dense in $(0, +\infty)$.
item.dc:creator: Sami Douba, Junzhi Huang

item.title: On lens spaces bounding smooth 4-manifolds with $\boldsymbol{b_2=1}$
item.description: arXiv:2410.22719v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study which lens spaces can bound smooth 4-manifolds with second Betti number one under various topological conditions. Specifically, we show that there are infinite families of lens spaces that bound compact, simply-connected, smooth 4-manifolds with second Betti number one, yet cannot bound a 4-manifold consisting of a single 0-handle and 2-handle. Additionally, we establish the existence of infinite families of lens spaces that bound compact, smooth 4-manifolds with first Betti number zero and second Betti number one, but cannot bound simply-connected 4-manifolds with second Betti number one. The construction of such 4-manifolds with lens space boundaries is motivated by the study of rational homology projective planes with cyclic quotient singularities.
item.dc:creator: Woohyeok Jo, Jongil Park, Kyungbae Park

item.title: Lifting criteria of closed curves to some finite covers of odd degree
item.description: arXiv:2411.00481v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We study the lifts of the closed curves in the bouquet of $n$ circles to a finite sheeted normal covering. We give necessary and sufficient conditions for a closed curve to admit a lift for a class of normal covers of odd degrees. As an application, we prove that, for any prime number $p$, a free group with $n$ $ (\geq 2)$ generators can be written as the union of subgroups of index $p$.
item.dc:creator: Deblina Das, Arpan Kabiraj

item.title: On the edge-chromatic number of 2-complexes
item.description: arXiv:2310.16905v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We propose an open question that seeks to generalise the Four Colour Theorem from two to three dimensions. As an appetiser, we show that 12 instead of four colours are both sufficient and necessary to colour every 2-complex that embeds in a prescribed 3-manifold. However, our example of a 2-complex that requires 12 colours is not simplicial.
item.dc:creator: Jan Kurkofka, Emily Nevinson

item.title: Zariski dense non-tempered subgroups in higher rank of nearly optimal growth
item.description: arXiv:2410.19551v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We provide the first example of a Zariski dense discrete non-lattice subgroup $\Gamma_0$ of a higher rank simple Lie group $G$, which is non-tempered in the sense that the associated quasi-regular representation $L^2(\Gamma_0\backslash G)$ is non-tempered. In fact, let $\Gamma$ be the fundamental group of a closed hyperbolic $n$-manifold with properly embedded totally geodesic hyperplane for $n\ge 3$. We prove that there exists a non-empty open subset $\cal O$ of $\rm{Hom}(\Gamma, \rm{SO}(n,2))$ such that for any $\sigma\in \mathcal O$, the image $\sigma(\Gamma)$ is a Zariski dense and non-tempered Anosov subgroup of $\rm{SO}(n,2)$. Moreover the growth indicator of $\sigma(\Gamma)$ is nearly optimal, that is, it almost realizes the supremum of growth indicators of all non-lattice discrete subgroups given by property $(T)$ of $\rm{SO}(n,2)$.
item.dc:creator: Mikolaj Fraczyk, Hee Oh
